title: Barnbrook's Priori and Hoefler's Proteus Project
content:
Take a look at Jonathan Barnbrook's [Priori](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075201/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=197) (from [Emigre](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075201/http:/www.emigre.com/)) an eclectic set of display faces. It is similar to Jonathan Hoefler's [Proteus Project](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075201/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/proteus/index.html), in the sense that a given underlying structure becomes the base for a mixture of eclectic fonts that somehow work very well together.   
   
I'm not saying Priori and Proteus Project look similar, I'm just noticing a similarity in the approach to building the family.   
   
Is this a fair comparison? Are there other font families that take a similar approach? What do you think?
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: And [the Shire Types](%22http://typography.net/type/shires/family/home.htm%22) (Tankard) seem to be doing something similar, too.
